document: Fit-again midfielder Jimmy Ryan had instant impact, setting up Ash Hunter to lob in the opener early on. Within minutes it was 2-0, with Bobby Grant nodding home Antoni Sarcevic's cross from the left...
reference_summary: Fleetwood boosted their survival hopes by beating Scunthorpe for just their second League One win of the year.
generated_summary: Fleetwood moved into the League One play-off places with victory over Scunthorpe.

content_relevance.comments: Good relevance. Captures the main teams (Fleetwood, Scunthorpe) and the league (League One). However, incorrect context - reference says 'survival hopes' and 'second win of the year', while prediction says 'play-off places', which has different implications.

coherence.comments: Excellent coherence. Complete, well-structured sentence with clear subject-verb-object. Flows naturally and forms a unified thought.

fluency.comments: Perfect fluency. Grammatically correct, natural phrasing, and professional sports journalism style. No errors.

factual_consistency.comments: Partially consistent. Correctly identifies teams and the victory. However, 'play-off places' vs 'survival hopes' is a significant difference - these are opposite ends of the league table, making this a factual error despite being plausible.

document: Liam Henderson opened the scoring with a terrific free-kick before John McGinn increased the lead against his former club. Stevie Mallan pulled one back with a free-kick of his own before half-time...
reference_summary: Hibernian moved to within two points of Rangers at the top of the Championship with a comfortable victory over St Mirren.
generated_summary: Hibernian moved back to the top of the Scottish Championship with victory over St Mirren.

content_relevance.comments: Very good relevance. Captures the main points: Hibernian's position, the league (Scottish Championship), and opponent (St Mirren). Minor difference: 'top of' vs 'within two points of Rangers at the top' - slight loss of precision.

coherence.comments: Excellent coherence. Clear, complete sentence with logical flow. Well-structured sports news summary.

fluency.comments: Perfect fluency. Grammatically flawless, natural language, appropriate for sports reporting.

factual_consistency.comments: Mostly consistent. Correctly identifies teams, league, and victory. 'Moved back to the top' vs 'moved to within two points of Rangers' is slightly different - implies they're first vs second, which is a minor factual discrepancy.

document: Lance Naik (Corporal) Hanamanthappa Koppad was tapped under 8m of snow at a height of nearly 6,000m along with nine other soldiers who all died. Their bodies have now been recovered. The critically ill...
reference_summary: An Indian soldier who was buried in an avalanche that struck the Siachen glacier in Indian-administered Kashmir six days ago has been found alive.
generated_summary: An Indian soldier who was buried under snow in an avalanche on the Siachen glacier in Indian-administered Kashmir last week remains in a coma, the army says.

content_relevance.comments: Good relevance. Captures most key elements: Indian soldier, avalanche, Siachen glacier, Kashmir, and medical condition. Main difference: emphasizes 'found alive' (reference) vs 'remains in a coma' (prediction) - both true but different focus.

coherence.comments: Excellent coherence. Complete, well-structured sentence with clear timeline and all necessary details. Flows logically.

fluency.comments: Perfect fluency. Grammatically correct, natural phrasing typical of news reporting. Professional and clear.

factual_consistency.comments: Highly consistent. All facts are accurate: Indian soldier, avalanche, Siachen glacier, Kashmir, medical status. 'Last week' is consistent with 'six days ago'. The coma status is implied in the document ('critically ill').
